channel.title: Please Read Could Help You. Ipconfig Cmd Error
channel.description:
Ok, Read this bit first becasue it'll save me alot of flaming and spamming. So I know this is a 5-10 minute tutorial but it can help alot of people... Thank you, Varii
Hi, This is Varii as you can see :D Anyway...
The Reason for this is to show you how to fix the Cmd error. Ok, So recently I have seen way too many people saying:
"When I type ipconfig in the cmd box it comes up as, 'ipconfig is not recognized as a internal or external command, operable program or batch file'. This is because when you change the 'PATH' and 'CLASSPATH' to Java it overwrites the original CMD.
So I'm Here Today to show you how to fix it.
Click Start then go to Computer.
In the path/adress bar where it says Computer and has the icon next to it, Click and delete that text and replace it with this Code %systemroot%\system32\cmd and hit enter.
In the black box type ipconfig and hit enter. Well there you go you have the ip adress, gateway, subnet mask and all other other information you need.
Thanks for Reading, Varii

item.dc:creator: @xx_Santa_pker_xX xx Santa pker xX
item.description:
@xx_Santa_pker_xX wrote:

Still doesnt help…i put %systemroot%\system32\cmd for variable path or w/e. IDK why its not working. I recentyl did a System Recovery and i had a server before. But my freind couldnt log on my server. So i said wtf. And then i had to port forward again. But this is stopping me. Never happened to me in my life.

Read full topic

item.title: Please Read Could Help You. Ipconfig Cmd Error
item.dc:creator: @Varii Varii
item.description:
@Varii wrote:

[quote=“d10n, post:4, topic:226762”]you’re not really making it clear, although i don’t need this :\ theres an easier way to do this…
ipconfig /all[/quote] The thing is with the regular CMD being overwritten with the java CMD none of the ipconfig commands work becasue you are typing the Windows commands into a Java command box… Meaning the Java CMD wont recognize the Windows CMD’s commands…

Read full topic
